This approach offers the most flexibility and is strongly recommended. < < For this, please follow our [Generating and Configuring a Mastercard API Client](https://developer.mastercard.com/platform/documentation/getting-started-with-mastercard-apis/generating-and-configuring-a-mastercard-api-client) tutorial with the following API specification: [OpenAPI Spec Download](https://static.developer.mastercard.com/content/match/swagger/match-pro.yaml) < < * Please ignore steps 5 and 7 as the MATCH Pro API does not currently have payload encryption. < < #### Using a method of your choice {#using-a-method-of-your-choice} < < MATCH Pro exposes a JSON-RPC API, you are free to use the HTTP client of your choice and can still leverage the Mastercard open-source [client libraries](https://developer.mastercard.com/platform/documentation/authentication/using-oauth-1a-to-access-mastercard-apis) for signing your requests. < < For that, please refer to the [MATCH Pro API Reference](https://developer.mastercard.com/match/documentation/api-reference/). < < ## Environments {#environments} < < | Environment. | Description | < |--------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| < | Sandbox | In the sandbox environment a mock service is running that provides sample responses based on the value of the 'referenceNumber'. To access Sandbox select MATCH Pro when setting up [My Projects](https://developer.mastercard.com/dashboard) | < | MTF | In MTF you can access the Match Pro MTF services. MTF environment is for testing purposes only to perform all user acceptance testing (UAT). To access MTF you need to select [Request MTF Access](https://developer.mastercard.com/dashboard) in the MATCH Pro project you have setup. | < | Production | In production you can access the Match Pro production services. To access production you need to select [Request Production Access](https://developer.mastercard.com/dashboard) in the MATCH Pro project you have setup. | < < < --- < < # Postman Collection < source: https://developer.mastercard.com/match/documentation/postman-collection/index.md < < Postman is an application for easy RESTful API exploration. You can use Postman to test API calls multiple times without having to write code. You can save multiple sets of credentials to quickly test an API's calls in the sandbox and production environments. < < See the following [Postman tutorial](https://developer.mastercard.com/platform/tutorial/use-postman-for-mastercard-apis) for the generic steps needed to get Mastercard authentication working with the Postman collection. < < Use the button below to fork our Postman collection and explore the API. < Click : [![](https://static.developer.mastercard.com/content/match/uploads/postman-button.svg)](https://www.postman.com/mastercard/workspace/mastercard-developers/collection/26779181-a8ada260-5c3d-4169-b1ab-08577f330d2d) You can download postman collection [MATCH_Pro_API_postman_collection.zip](https://static.developer.mastercard.com/content/match/uploads/MATCH_Pro_API_postman_collection.zip) (13KB) < < --- < < # API Reference < source: https://developer.mastercard.com/match/documentation/api-reference/index.md < < Note: To be notified of any planned maintenance outages, each MATCH Pro user needs to ensure: < < * Each authorized user should update their contact information on regular basis, including email, on **My Company Manager** . All communication regarding planned outages and retroactive notifications are sent to the email address associated with the MATCH Pro contact in **My Company Manager** . < * Refer to the MATCH Pro User Manual for more information. < < ## Environment Domains {#environment-domains} < < * Sandbox < * MTF < * Production < < ```Sandbox < https://sandbox.api.mastercard.com/mcp/match/api < ``` < < ```MTF < https://api.mastercard.com/mtf/mcp/match/api < ``` < < ```Production < https://api.mastercard.com/mcp/match/api < ``` < < ## APIs {#apis} < < < API Specification: `https://static.developer.mastercard.com/content/match/swagger/match-pro.yaml` < < The [error](https://developer.mastercard.com/match/documentation/code-and-formats/index.md) page provides description for issues that you may come across after integrating with MATCH Pro APIs. < < For specification change logs, refer to the [release history.](https://developer.mastercard.com/match/documentation/support/index.md#release-history) < < ## Sandbox Data {#sandbox-data} < < The Developer Portal sandbox is a self-contained area of the Mastercard API platform that provides a simulated experience that mimics MATCH Pro API production environment. This allows Authorized users to test various scenarios prior to their MATCH Pro API project going live. < < * The MATCH Pro sandbox is public; any Authorized user can access the testing environment without Mastercard's approval using the Quick Start Guide on Mastercard Developers. < * The testing environment is dynamic; Authorized users can add any record to the sandbox to test specific scenarios in the API. < * The MATCH Pro Sandbox has the same resources that are available in production but contains fictitious data. < * Only one acquirer ICA (1996) is used in the sandbox for testing. < * API testing can be completed independently based on each Authorized user's test cases. < * To begin sandbox testing, please see the API Tutorial on [Mastercard Developers](https://developer.mastercard.com/). < < **For any questions during testing, please contact [apisupport@mastercard.com](mailto:apisupport@mastercard.com).** < < --- < < # Code and Formats < source: https://developer.mastercard.com/match/documentation/code-and-formats/index.md --- > For technical support and implementation assistance: > - Mastercard Developer Portal > - Technical documentation and guides > - Sample code and SDKs > - Professional services consultation > - Member Testing Facility access 232,471c120 < ## Errors {#errors} < < If a transaction can't be processed, an error will occur. The errors can be for system, service or even network issues. < < **Why would I need to use this resource?** < < This resource is provided to you in the event the transaction can't be completed. The error can be for a specific service format issue, network connection or overall message format issue. < < #### Response Values {#response-values} < < **Source** < < **Description:** This is the unique identifier that attempts to define the field in error when available. If a specific field can't be identified, System will be returned. < < **Example:** If an error is produced because of required data it would be presented with the field missing data. < < * Request.PayloadSecurity.Credential < * addMerchantRequest.merchant < <
< < \*\*ReasonCode\*\* < \*\*Description:\*\* This will identify the reason for the error. < \*\*Example:\*\* < < * INVALID_INPUT_VALUE < * SECURITY_CREDENTIAL_MISSING < * SECURITY_CREDENTIAL_UNAUTHORIZED < * VOLUME_THRESHOLD_EXCEEDED < <
< < \*\*Description\*\* < \*\*Description:\*\* This is the text description of the error. This is optional and will only be displayed if more information is available than is stored in the data identifier and reason code. < \*\*Example:\*\* < < * Merchant Principals exceed length 5 < * The system is experiencing heavy traffic volume, please try again later < * Maximum requests exceeded for the current time window < <
< < \*\*Recoverable\*\* < \*\*Description:\*\* This is a true/false presentation to explain if the transaction was submitted again would it be successful or not. < \*\*Example:\*\* True or False < < \*\*Sample Response\*\* \`\`\` { "Errors": { "Error": \[ { "Source": "Gateway", "ReasonCode": "INVALID_INPUT_FORMAT", "Description": "Payload too large. Limit: KB", "Recoverable": false, "Details": null } \] } } \`\`\` < < ### AUTH Error Code: {#auth-error-codebr} < < | Sr.No. | Description | HTTP Status Code | AUTH RESPONSE CODE | < |--------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------|-----------------------------------| < | 1 | The Authorization header is missing from the request or OAuth parameters are missing from the header. Check the Authorization Header. | 400 | INVALID_OAUTH_SBS | < | 2 | The value for oauth_consumer_key doesn't conform to the length/format requirements (97-character length, with an exclamation mark in the middle). | 400 | INVALID_OAUTH_CONSUMER_KEY | < | 3 | The value for oauth_consumer_key doesn't match an existing key or doesn't have access to the requested API. | 400 | INVALID_CLIENT_ID, INVALID_KEY_ID | < | 4 | The value for oauth_signature_method is invalid or not supported. | 400 | INVALID_OAUTH_SIGNATURE_METHOD | < | 5 | The value for oauth_timestamp was rejected. Check your clock is accurate . See below: **oauth_nonce and oauth_timestamp.** The OAuth nonce is a random string, uniquely generated for each request and also unique within a given time window. The request timestamp is a positive integer representing the number of seconds since 1970. It must match the current time. In this example, 1558370962 is equivalent to 05/20/2019 @ 4:49pm (UTC). The timestamp and nonce pair must be unique, or the request will be treated as a replay attack. | 403 | INVALID_OAUTH_TIMESTAMP | < | 6 | The value of oauth_nonce was already used. Check you actually send a different nonce with each new request and that your system is generating enough entropy. See above: **oauth_nonce and oauth_timestamp.** | 403 | OAUTH_NONCE_USED | < | 7 | The value of oauth_body_hash is incorrect. You can check: 1. content.content:
1# MATCH Pro Platform Documentation
     2
     3**Version:** 2.0 (Post-Architecture Simplification)
     4**Last Updated:** September 30, 2025
     5**Platform Status:** Production Ready 
     6
     7---
     8
     9##  Documentation Organization
    10
    11This documentation is organized into four main categories based on intended audience and access level:
    12
    13###  Platform Documentation (External Sharing)
    14**Location:** `/docs/platform-docs/`
    15**Audience:** Banks, auditors, compliance officers, third-party integrators
    16**Access Level:** Approved for external distribution
    17
    18- **[API Documentation](./platform-docs/api/)** - Complete API references
    19- **[User Guides](./platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user training and procedures
    20- **[Compliance Documentation](./platform-docs/compliance/)** - FDIC and regulatory compliance guides
    21
    22###  Internal Documentation (Development Team)
    23**Location:** `/docs/internal/`
    24**Audience:** Development team, DevOps, technical staff
    25**Access Level:** Internal use only
    26
    27- **[Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)** -  **CORE PHILOSOPHY**
    28- **[Implementation Plans](./internal/)** - Technical roadmaps and architecture decisions
    29- **[Operational Runbooks](./internal/runbooks/)** - Deployment and maintenance procedures
    30
    31###  Reports (Testing & Compliance)
    32**Location:** `/docs/reports/`
    33**Audience:** Management, auditors, compliance officers
    34**Access Level:** Controlled distribution
    35
    36- **[Test Reports](./reports/)** - Security audits, performance testing, compliance verification
    37- **[Phase Reviews](./reports/)** - Project milestone assessments and technical reviews
    38
    39###  Archive (Historical Reference)
    40**Location:** `/docs/archive/`
    41**Audience:** Development team (historical reference)
    42**Access Level:** Read-only archive
    43
    44- **[Historical Documentation](./archive/)** - Superseded plans and legacy documentation
    45
    46---
    47
    48##  Quick Start Guide
    49
    50### For New Developers
    511. **Start Here:** [Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md) - **MANDATORY READ**
    522. **Architecture:** [CLAUDE.md](../CLAUDE.md) - Simplified platform overview
    533. **Deployment:** [MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)
    544. **Operations:** [Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)
    55
    56### For Bank Administrators
    571. **Platform Overview:** [FDIC Compliance Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)
    582. **User Management:** [User Guides](./platform-docs/user-guides/)
    593. **API Integration:** [API Documentation](./platform-docs/api/)
    60
    61### For Auditors & Compliance
    621. **Compliance Framework:** [FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)
    632. **Security Reports:** [Test Reports](./reports/)
    643. **Operational Procedures:** [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)
    65
    66---
    67
    68##  Platform Overview
    69
    70The MATCH Pro platform is a **simplified** financial compliance solution designed for banks with limited resources. Following the architecture simplification initiative, it delivers essential compliance functionality with minimal operational overhead.
    71
    72### Core Capabilities
    73- **MATCH Pro Integration:** Mastercard merchant termination screening
    74- **OFAC Screening:** Direct Treasury sanctions list integration
    75- **ORC Risk Assessment:** Comprehensive business risk evaluation
    76- **User Management:** Role-based access with ICA data isolation
    77
    78### Architecture Philosophy
    79> **"Build a Toyota Camry that works reliably, not a Formula 1 car that requires a pit crew."**
    80
    81The platform prioritizes:
    82- **Simplicity** over complexity
    83- **Maintainability** over optimization
    84- **Standard solutions** over custom implementations
    85- **Operational efficiency** for small teams
    86
    87### Simplification Results
    88- **50% reduction** in codebase size (295  150 files)
    89- **75% reduction** in configuration complexity (150+  40 variables)
    90- **Deployment time** reduced from 4-6 hours to 1-2 hours
    91- **Onboarding time** reduced from 2-3 months to 2-3 weeks
    92
    93---
    94
    95##  Documentation Index
    96
    97### Platform Documentation (External Sharing) 
    98
    99#### API Documentation
   100- **[MATCH Pro API](./platform-docs/api/match-pro.md)** - Mastercard MATCH Pro integration guide
   101- **[OFAC API](./platform-docs/api/ofac-api-documentation.md)** - Treasury sanctions screening API
   102- **[ORC API](./platform-docs/api/onboard-risk-check.md)** - Onboard Risk Check integration
   103
   104#### User Guides & Training
   105- **[OFAC Service Guide](./platform-docs/user-guides/ofac-service-guide.md)** - Complete OFAC implementation guide
   106- **[User Training Materials](./platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user documentation
   107
   108#### Compliance & Security
   109- **[FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)** -  **REQUIRED** - Regulatory compliance guide
   110
   111### Internal Documentation (Development Team) 
   112
   113#### Core Philosophy & Standards
   114- **[Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)** -  **MANDATORY** - Simplicity and maintainability guidelines
   115- **[Architecture Simplification Plan](./internal/architecture-simplification-plan.md)** - Complete simplification initiative documentation
   116
   117#### Implementation & Planning
   118- **[Implementation Plan](./internal/implementation-plan.md)** - Overall project roadmap and current status
   119- **[Implementation Plan v2](./internal/implementation-plan-v2.md)** - Updated post-simplification roadmap
   120
   121#### Operational Procedures
   122- **[MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)** - Production deployment guide
   123- **[Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)** - Daily operations and maintenance
   124
   125### Reports (Testing & Compliance) 
   126
   127#### Testing Reports
   128- **[Test Reports Index](./reports/test-reports-index.md)** - Complete testing summary
   129- **[Security Audit Reports](./reports/)** - Security assessments and penetration testing
   130- **[Performance Testing](./reports/)** - Load testing and performance analysis
   131- **[Compliance Verification](./reports/)** - Regulatory compliance testing
   132
   133#### Project Reviews
   134- **[FDIC Compliance Assessment](./reports/fdic-compliance-assessment-2025-09-29.md)** - Regulatory compliance evaluation
   135- **[Phase Reviews](./reports/)** - Project milestone assessments
   136
   137### Archive (Historical Reference) 
   138
   139#### Pre-Simplification Documentation
   140- **[Historical Plans](./archive/)** - Original implementation plans and complex architecture docs
   141- **[Legacy Documentation](./archive/)** - Superseded guides and deprecated procedures
   142
   143---
   144
   145##  Technology Stack
   146
   147### Frontend
   148- **Framework:** Next.js 15 with App Router
   149- **UI:** React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS v4
   150- **Components:** shadcn/ui component library
   151- **State:** Simplified state management
   152
   153### Backend
   154- **API:** Fastify with consolidated middleware (3 layers)
   155- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM
   156- **Authentication:** JWT with role-based access control
   157- **Validation:** Shared Zod schemas
   158
   159### Infrastructure
   160- **Frontend Hosting:** Vercel (automatic deployment)
   161- **Backend Hosting:** Railway (container deployment)
   162- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL (managed service)
   163- **Monitoring:** Built-in platform monitoring
   164
   165### Removed Complexity
   166- **No Redis:** Simple in-memory caching
   167- **No Queue Systems:** Direct processing for low-volume operations
   168- **No Custom Middleware:** Standard patterns only
   169- **No Complex Scripts:** Manual procedures with runbooks
   170
   171---
   172
   173##  Security & Compliance
   174
   175### Security Framework
   176- **Authentication:** JWT with proper expiration
   177- **Authorization:** Simplified role-based access control
   178- **Data Protection:** Field-level encryption for PII
   179- **Input Validation:** Comprehensive Zod schema validation
   180- **Rate Limiting:** Simple global rate limiting
   181
   182### Compliance Standards
   183- **FDIC Requirements:** Full regulatory compliance
   184- **Banking Standards:** Industry best practices
   185- **Audit Readiness:** Complete audit trails and documentation
   186- **Data Protection:** PII encryption and secure handling
   187
   188### Security Monitoring
   189- **Health Checks:** Automated system monitoring
   190- **Error Tracking:** Comprehensive error logging
   191- **Access Control:** Role-based permission system
   192- **Audit Logging:** Complete activity tracking
   193
   194---
   195
   196##  Support & Contacts
   197
   198### Documentation Feedback
   199- **Technical Questions:** Review [Internal Documentation](./internal/)
   200- **User Guide Issues:** Check [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)
   201- **Compliance Questions:** Reference [Compliance Documentation](./platform-docs/compliance/)
   202

# MATCH Pro Platform Documentation

**Version:** 2.0 (Post-Architecture Simplification)
**Last Updated:** September 30, 2025
**Platform Status:** Production Ready 

---

##  Documentation Organization

This documentation is organized into four main categories based on intended audience and access level:

###  Platform Documentation (External Sharing)
**Location:** `/docs/platform-docs/`
**Audience:** Banks, auditors, compliance officers, third-party integrators
**Access Level:** Approved for external distribution

- **[API Documentation](./platform-docs/api/)** - Complete API references
- **[User Guides](./platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user training and procedures
- **[Compliance Documentation](./platform-docs/compliance/)** - FDIC and regulatory compliance guides

###  Internal Documentation (Development Team)
**Location:** `/docs/internal/`
**Audience:** Development team, DevOps, technical staff
**Access Level:** Internal use only

- **[Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)** -  **CORE PHILOSOPHY**
- **[Implementation Plans](./internal/)** - Technical roadmaps and architecture decisions
- **[Operational Runbooks](./internal/runbooks/)** - Deployment and maintenance procedures

###  Reports (Testing & Compliance)
**Location:** `/docs/reports/`
**Audience:** Management, auditors, compliance officers
**Access Level:** Controlled distribution

- **[Test Reports](./reports/)** - Security audits, performance testing, compliance verification
- **[Phase Reviews](./reports/)** - Project milestone assessments and technical reviews

###  Archive (Historical Reference)
**Location:** `/docs/archive/`
**Audience:** Development team (historical reference)
**Access Level:** Read-only archive

- **[Historical Documentation](./archive/)** - Superseded plans and legacy documentation

---

##  Quick Start Guide

### For New Developers
1. **Start Here:** [Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md) - **MANDATORY READ**
2. **Architecture:** [CLAUDE.md](../CLAUDE.md) - Simplified platform overview
3. **Deployment:** [MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)
4. **Operations:** [Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)

### For Bank Administrators
1. **Platform Overview:** [FDIC Compliance Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)
2. **User Management:** [User Guides](./platform-docs/user-guides/)
3. **API Integration:** [API Documentation](./platform-docs/api/)

### For Auditors & Compliance
1. **Compliance Framework:** [FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)
2. **Security Reports:** [Test Reports](./reports/)
3. **Operational Procedures:** [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)

---

##  Platform Overview

The MATCH Pro platform is a **simplified** financial compliance solution designed for banks with limited resources. Following the architecture simplification initiative, it delivers essential compliance functionality with minimal operational overhead.

### Core Capabilities
- **MATCH Pro Integration:** Mastercard merchant termination screening
- **OFAC Screening:** Direct Treasury sanctions list integration
- **ORC Risk Assessment:** Comprehensive business risk evaluation
- **User Management:** Role-based access with ICA data isolation

### Architecture Philosophy
> **"Build a Toyota Camry that works reliably, not a Formula 1 car that requires a pit crew."**

The platform prioritizes:
- **Simplicity** over complexity
- **Maintainability** over optimization
- **Standard solutions** over custom implementations
- **Operational efficiency** for small teams

### Simplification Results
- **50% reduction** in codebase size (295  150 files)
- **75% reduction** in configuration complexity (150+  40 variables)
- **Deployment time** reduced from 4-6 hours to 1-2 hours
- **Onboarding time** reduced from 2-3 months to 2-3 weeks

---

##  Documentation Index

### Platform Documentation (External Sharing) 

#### API Documentation
- **[MATCH Pro API](./platform-docs/api/match-pro.md)** - Mastercard MATCH Pro integration guide
- **[OFAC API](./platform-docs/api/ofac-api-documentation.md)** - Treasury sanctions screening API
- **[ORC API](./platform-docs/api/onboard-risk-check.md)** - Onboard Risk Check integration

#### User Guides & Training
- **[OFAC Service Guide](./platform-docs/user-guides/ofac-service-guide.md)** - Complete OFAC implementation guide
- **[User Training Materials](./platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user documentation

#### Compliance & Security
- **[FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)** -  **REQUIRED** - Regulatory compliance guide

### Internal Documentation (Development Team) 

#### Core Philosophy & Standards
- **[Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)** -  **MANDATORY** - Simplicity and maintainability guidelines
- **[Architecture Simplification Plan](./internal/architecture-simplification-plan.md)** - Complete simplification initiative documentation

#### Implementation & Planning
- **[Implementation Plan](./internal/implementation-plan.md)** - Overall project roadmap and current status
- **[Implementation Plan v2](./internal/implementation-plan-v2.md)** - Updated post-simplification roadmap

#### Operational Procedures
- **[MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)** - Production deployment guide
- **[Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)** - Daily operations and maintenance

### Reports (Testing & Compliance) 

#### Testing Reports
- **[Test Reports Index](./reports/test-reports-index.md)** - Complete testing summary
- **[Security Audit Reports](./reports/)** - Security assessments and penetration testing
- **[Performance Testing](./reports/)** - Load testing and performance analysis
- **[Compliance Verification](./reports/)** - Regulatory compliance testing

#### Project Reviews
- **[FDIC Compliance Assessment](./reports/fdic-compliance-assessment-2025-09-29.md)** - Regulatory compliance evaluation
- **[Phase Reviews](./reports/)** - Project milestone assessments

### Archive (Historical Reference) 

#### Pre-Simplification Documentation
- **[Historical Plans](./archive/)** - Original implementation plans and complex architecture docs
- **[Legacy Documentation](./archive/)** - Superseded guides and deprecated procedures

---

##  Technology Stack

### Frontend
- **Framework:** Next.js 15 with App Router
- **UI:** React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS v4
- **Components:** shadcn/ui component library
- **State:** Simplified state management

### Backend
- **API:** Fastify with consolidated middleware (3 layers)
- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM
- **Authentication:** JWT with role-based access control
- **Validation:** Shared Zod schemas

### Infrastructure
- **Frontend Hosting:** Vercel (automatic deployment)
- **Backend Hosting:** Railway (container deployment)
- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL (managed service)
- **Monitoring:** Built-in platform monitoring

### Removed Complexity
- **No Redis:** Simple in-memory caching
- **No Queue Systems:** Direct processing for low-volume operations
- **No Custom Middleware:** Standard patterns only
- **No Complex Scripts:** Manual procedures with runbooks

---

##  Security & Compliance

### Security Framework
- **Authentication:** JWT with proper expiration
- **Authorization:** Simplified role-based access control
- **Data Protection:** Field-level encryption for PII
- **Input Validation:** Comprehensive Zod schema validation
- **Rate Limiting:** Simple global rate limiting

### Compliance Standards
- **FDIC Requirements:** Full regulatory compliance
- **Banking Standards:** Industry best practices
- **Audit Readiness:** Complete audit trails and documentation
- **Data Protection:** PII encryption and secure handling

### Security Monitoring
- **Health Checks:** Automated system monitoring
- **Error Tracking:** Comprehensive error logging
- **Access Control:** Role-based permission system
- **Audit Logging:** Complete activity tracking

---

##  Support & Contacts

### Documentation Feedback
- **Technical Questions:** Review [Internal Documentation](./internal/)
- **User Guide Issues:** Check [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)
- **Compliance Questions:** Reference [Compliance Documentation](./platform-docs/compliance/)

### Emergency Procedures
- **Incident Response:** Follow [Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)
- **System Issues:** Reference [MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)
- **Emergency Contacts:** Listed in operational runbooks

### Development Team
- **Architecture Questions:** Review [Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)
- **Implementation Guidance:** Check [Implementation Plans](./internal/)
- **Deployment Issues:** Follow [Operational Runbooks](./internal/runbooks/)

---

##  Document Maintenance

### Review Schedule
- **Monthly:** Operational procedures and user guides
- **Quarterly:** Technical documentation and compliance guides
- **Annually:** Complete documentation audit and architecture review

### Version Control
- All documentation changes tracked in git
- Major revisions documented with date and rationale
- Archived versions maintained for historical reference

### Access Control
- **Platform Documentation:** Approved for external sharing
- **Internal Documentation:** Development team access only
- **Reports:** Controlled distribution based on content sensitivity
- **Archive:** Read-only historical reference

---

**Documentation Maintained By:** Development Team
**Last Major Update:** September 30, 2025 (Architecture Simplification)
**Next Review:** December 30, 2025

# MATCH Pro Platform Documentation

**Version:** 3.0 (Post-Phase 4 Documentation Consolidation)
**Last Updated:** November 1, 2024
**Platform Status:** Production Ready 

---

##  Documentation Organization

This documentation is organized into four main categories based on intended audience and access level:

###  Platform Documentation (External Sharing)
**Location:** `/docs/platform-docs/`
**Audience:** Banks, auditors, compliance officers, third-party integrators
**Access Level:** Approved for external distribution

- **[API Documentation](./platform-docs/api/)** - Complete API references
- **[User Guides](./platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user training and procedures
- **[Compliance Documentation](./platform-docs/compliance/)** - FDIC and regulatory compliance guides

###  Internal Documentation (Development Team)
**Location:** `/docs/internal/`
**Audience:** Development team, DevOps, technical staff
**Access Level:** Internal use only

- **[Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)** -  **CORE PHILOSOPHY**
- **[Implementation Plans](./internal/)** - Technical roadmaps and architecture decisions
- **[Operational Runbooks](./internal/runbooks/)** - Deployment and maintenance procedures

###  Reports (Testing & Compliance)
**Location:** `/docs/reports/`
**Audience:** Management, auditors, compliance officers
**Access Level:** Controlled distribution

- **[Test Reports](./reports/)** - Security audits, performance testing, compliance verification
- **[Phase Reviews](./reports/)** - Project milestone assessments and technical reviews

###  Archive (Historical Reference)
**Location:** `/docs/archive/`
**Audience:** Development team (historical reference)
**Access Level:** Read-only archive

- **[Historical Documentation](./archive/)** - Superseded plans and legacy documentation

---

##  Quick Start Guide

### For New Developers
1. **Start Here:** [Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md) - **MANDATORY READ**
2. **Architecture:** [CLAUDE.md](../CLAUDE.md) - Simplified platform overview
3. **Deployment:** [MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)
4. **Operations:** [Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)

### For Bank Administrators
1. **Platform Overview:** [FDIC Compliance Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)
2. **User Management:** [User Guides](./platform-docs/user-guides/)
3. **API Integration:** [API Documentation](./platform-docs/api/)

### For Auditors & Compliance
1. **Compliance Framework:** [FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)
2. **Security Reports:** [Test Reports](./reports/)
3. **Operational Procedures:** [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)

---

##  Platform Overview

The MATCH Pro platform is a **simplified** financial compliance solution designed for banks with limited resources. Following the architecture simplification initiative, it delivers essential compliance functionality with minimal operational overhead.

### Core Capabilities
- **MATCH Pro Integration:** Mastercard merchant termination screening
- **OFAC Screening:** Direct Treasury sanctions list integration
- **ORC Risk Assessment:** Comprehensive business risk evaluation
- **User Management:** Role-based access with ICA data isolation

### Architecture Philosophy
> **"Build a Toyota Camry that works reliably, not a Formula 1 car that requires a pit crew."**

The platform prioritizes:
- **Simplicity** over complexity
- **Maintainability** over optimization
- **Standard solutions** over custom implementations
- **Operational efficiency** for small teams

### Simplification Results
- **50% reduction** in codebase size (295  150 files)
- **75% reduction** in configuration complexity (150+  40 variables)
- **Deployment time** reduced from 4-6 hours to 1-2 hours
- **Onboarding time** reduced from 2-3 months to 2-3 weeks

---

##  Documentation Index

### Platform Documentation (External Sharing) 

#### API Documentation
- **[MATCH Pro API](./platform-docs/api/match-pro.md)** - Mastercard MATCH Pro integration guide
- **[OFAC API](./platform-docs/api/ofac-api-documentation.md)** - Treasury sanctions screening API
- **[ORC API](./platform-docs/api/onboard-risk-check.md)** - Onboard Risk Check integration

#### User Guides & Training
- **[OFAC Service Guide](./platform-docs/user-guides/ofac-service-guide.md)** - Complete OFAC implementation guide
- **[User Training Materials](./platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user documentation

#### Compliance & Security
- **[FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)** -  **REQUIRED** - Regulatory compliance guide

### Internal Documentation (Development Team) 

#### Core Philosophy & Standards
- **[Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)** -  **MANDATORY** - Simplicity and maintainability guidelines
- **[Architecture Simplification Plan](./internal/architecture-simplification-plan.md)** - Complete simplification initiative documentation

#### Implementation & Planning
- **[Implementation Plan](./internal/implementation-plan.md)** - Overall project roadmap and current status
- **[Implementation Plan v2](./internal/implementation-plan-v2.md)** - Updated post-simplification roadmap

#### Operational Procedures
- **[MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)** - Production deployment guide
- **[Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)** - Daily operations and maintenance

### Reports (Testing & Compliance) 

#### Testing Reports
- **[Test Reports Index](./reports/test-reports-index.md)** - Complete testing summary
- **[Security Audit Reports](./reports/)** - Security assessments and penetration testing
- **[Performance Testing](./reports/)** - Load testing and performance analysis
- **[Compliance Verification](./reports/)** - Regulatory compliance testing

#### Project Reviews
- **[FDIC Compliance Assessment](./reports/fdic-compliance-assessment-2025-09-29.md)** - Regulatory compliance evaluation
- **[Phase Reviews](./reports/)** - Project milestone assessments

### Archive (Historical Reference) 

#### Pre-Simplification Documentation
- **[Historical Plans](./archive/)** - Original implementation plans and complex architecture docs
- **[Legacy Documentation](./archive/)** - Superseded guides and deprecated procedures

---

##  Technology Stack

### Frontend
- **Framework:** Next.js 15 with App Router
- **UI:** React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS v4
- **Components:** shadcn/ui component library
- **State:** Simplified state management

### Backend
- **API:** Fastify with consolidated middleware (3 layers)
- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM
- **Authentication:** JWT with role-based access control
- **Validation:** Shared Zod schemas

### Infrastructure
- **Frontend Hosting:** Vercel (automatic deployment)
- **Backend Hosting:** Railway (container deployment)
- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL (managed service)
- **Monitoring:** Built-in platform monitoring

### Removed Complexity
- **No Redis:** Simple in-memory caching
- **No Queue Systems:** Direct processing for low-volume operations
- **No Custom Middleware:** Standard patterns only
- **No Complex Scripts:** Manual procedures with runbooks

---

##  Security & Compliance

### Security Framework
- **Authentication:** JWT with proper expiration
- **Authorization:** Simplified role-based access control
- **Data Protection:** Field-level encryption for PII
- **Input Validation:** Comprehensive Zod schema validation
- **Rate Limiting:** Simple global rate limiting

### Compliance Standards
- **FDIC Requirements:** Full regulatory compliance
- **Banking Standards:** Industry best practices
- **Audit Readiness:** Complete audit trails and documentation
- **Data Protection:** PII encryption and secure handling

### Security Monitoring
- **Health Checks:** Automated system monitoring
- **Error Tracking:** Comprehensive error logging
- **Access Control:** Role-based permission system
- **Audit Logging:** Complete activity tracking

---

##  Support & Contacts

### Documentation Feedback
- **Technical Questions:** Review [Internal Documentation](./internal/)
- **User Guide Issues:** Check [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)
- **Compliance Questions:** Reference [Compliance Documentation](./platform-docs/compliance/)

### Emergency Procedures
- **Incident Response:** Follow [Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)
- **System Issues:** Reference [MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)
- **Emergency Contacts:** Listed in operational runbooks

### Development Team
- **Architecture Questions:** Review [Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)
- **Implementation Guidance:** Check [Implementation Plans](./internal/)
- **Deployment Issues:** Follow [Operational Runbooks](./internal/runbooks/)

---

##  Document Maintenance

### Review Schedule
- **Monthly:** Operational procedures and user guides
- **Quarterly:** Technical documentation and compliance guides
- **Annually:** Complete documentation audit and architecture review

### Version Control
- All documentation changes tracked in git
- Major revisions documented with date and rationale
- Archived versions maintained for historical reference

### Access Control
- **Platform Documentation:** Approved for external sharing
- **Internal Documentation:** Development team access only
- **Reports:** Controlled distribution based on content sensitivity
- **Archive:** Read-only historical reference

---

**Documentation Maintained By:** Development Team
**Last Major Update:** September 30, 2025 (Architecture Simplification)
**Next Review:** December 30, 2025

2. **User Management:** [User Guides](./platform-docs/user-guides/)
3. **API Integration:** [API Documentation](./platform-docs/api/)

### For Auditors & Compliance
1. **Compliance Framework:** [FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)
2. **Security Reports:** [Test Reports](./reports/)
3. **Operational Procedures:** [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)

---

##  Platform Overview

The MATCH Pro platform is a **simplified** financial compliance solution designed for banks with limited resources. Following the architecture simplification initiative, it delivers essential compliance functionality with minimal operational overhead.

### Core Capabilities
- **MATCH Pro Integration:** Mastercard merchant termination screening
- **OFAC Screening:** Direct Treasury sanctions list integration
- **ORC Risk Assessment:** Comprehensive business risk evaluation
- **User Management:** Role-based access with ICA data isolation

### Architecture Philosophy
> **"Build a Toyota Camry that works reliably, not a Formula 1 car that requires a pit crew."**

The platform prioritizes:
- **Simplicity** over complexity
- **Maintainability** over optimization
- **Standard solutions** over custom implementations
- **Operational efficiency** for small teams

### Simplification Results
- **50% reduction** in codebase size (295  150 files)
- **75% reduction** in configuration complexity (150+  40 variables)
- **Deployment time** reduced from 4-6 hours to 1-2 hours
- **Onboarding time** reduced from 2-3 months to 2-3 weeks

---

##  Documentation Index

### Platform Documentation (External Sharing) 

#### API Documentation
- **[MATCH Pro API](./platform-docs/api/match-pro.md)** - Mastercard MATCH Pro integration guide
- **[OFAC API](./platform-docs/api/ofac-api-documentation.md)** - Treasury sanctions screening API
- **[ORC API](./platform-docs/api/onboard-risk-check.md)** - Onboard Risk Check integration

#### User Guides & Training
- **[OFAC Service Guide](./platform-docs/user-guides/ofac-service-guide.md)** - Complete OFAC implementation guide
- **[User Training Materials](./platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user documentation

#### Compliance & Security
- **[FDIC Best Practices](./platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)** -  **REQUIRED** - Regulatory compliance guide

### Internal Documentation (Development Team) 

#### Core Philosophy & Standards
- **[Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)** -  **MANDATORY** - Simplicity and maintainability guidelines
- **[Architecture Simplification Plan](./internal/architecture-simplification-plan.md)** - Complete simplification initiative documentation

#### Implementation & Planning
- **[Implementation Plan](./internal/implementation-plan.md)** - Overall project roadmap and current status
- **[Implementation Plan v2](./internal/implementation-plan-v2.md)** - Updated post-simplification roadmap

#### Operational Procedures
- **[MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)** - Production deployment guide
- **[Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)** - Daily operations and maintenance

### Reports (Testing & Compliance) 

#### Testing Reports
- **[Test Reports Index](./reports/test-reports-index.md)** - Complete testing summary
- **[Security Audit Reports](./reports/)** - Security assessments and penetration testing
- **[Performance Testing](./reports/)** - Load testing and performance analysis
- **[Compliance Verification](./reports/)** - Regulatory compliance testing

#### Project Reviews
- **[FDIC Compliance Assessment](./reports/fdic-compliance-assessment-2025-09-29.md)** - Regulatory compliance evaluation
- **[Phase Reviews](./reports/)** - Project milestone assessments

### Archive (Historical Reference) 

#### Pre-Simplification Documentation
- **[Historical Plans](./archive/)** - Original implementation plans and complex architecture docs
- **[Legacy Documentation](./archive/)** - Superseded guides and deprecated procedures

---

##  Technology Stack

### Frontend
- **Framework:** Next.js 15 with App Router
- **UI:** React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS v4
- **Components:** shadcn/ui component library
- **State:** Simplified state management

### Backend
- **API:** Fastify with consolidated middleware (3 layers)
- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM
- **Authentication:** JWT with role-based access control
- **Validation:** Shared Zod schemas

### Infrastructure
- **Frontend Hosting:** Vercel (automatic deployment)
- **Backend Hosting:** Railway (container deployment)
- **Database:** Neon PostgreSQL (managed service)
- **Monitoring:** Built-in platform monitoring

### Removed Complexity
- **No Redis:** Simple in-memory caching
- **No Queue Systems:** Direct processing for low-volume operations
- **No Custom Middleware:** Standard patterns only
- **No Complex Scripts:** Manual procedures with runbooks

---

##  Security & Compliance

### Security Framework
- **Authentication:** JWT with proper expiration
- **Authorization:** Simplified role-based access control
- **Data Protection:** Field-level encryption for PII
- **Input Validation:** Comprehensive Zod schema validation
- **Rate Limiting:** Simple global rate limiting

### Compliance Standards
- **FDIC Requirements:** Full regulatory compliance
- **Banking Standards:** Industry best practices
- **Audit Readiness:** Complete audit trails and documentation
- **Data Protection:** PII encryption and secure handling

### Security Monitoring
- **Health Checks:** Automated system monitoring
- **Error Tracking:** Comprehensive error logging
- **Access Control:** Role-based permission system
- **Audit Logging:** Complete activity tracking

---

##  Support & Contacts

### Documentation Feedback
- **Technical Questions:** Review [Internal Documentation](./internal/)
- **User Guide Issues:** Check [Platform Documentation](./platform-docs/)
- **Compliance Questions:** Reference [Compliance Documentation](./platform-docs/compliance/)

### Emergency Procedures
- **Incident Response:** Follow [Operational Procedures](./internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)
- **System Issues:** Reference [MVP Deployment Checklist](./internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md)
- **Emergency Contacts:** Listed in operational runbooks

### Development Team
- **Architecture Questions:** Review [Development Principles](./internal/development-principles.md)
- **Implementation Guidance:** Check [Implementation Plans](./internal/)
- **Deployment Issues:** Follow [Operational Runbooks](./internal/runbooks/)

---

##  Document Maintenance

### Review Schedule
- **Monthly:** Operational procedures and user guides
- **Quarterly:** Technical documentation and compliance guides
- **Annually:** Complete documentation audit and architecture review

### Version Control
- All documentation changes tracked in git
- Major revisions documented with date and rationale
- Archived versions maintained for historical reference

### Access Control
- **Platform Documentation:** Approved for external sharing
- **Internal Documentation:** Development team access only
- **Reports:** Controlled distribution based on content sensitivity
- **Archive:** Read-only historical reference

---

**Last Major Update:** September 30, 2025 (Architecture Simplification)
**Next Review:** December 30, 2025

content.content:
1# CLAUDE.md
     2
     3This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
     4
     5##  CRITICAL GIT GUIDELINES - READ FIRST 
     6
     7**NEVER mention Claude in commit messages or PR descriptions**
     8-  Bad: "Claude fixed the TypeScript errors"
     9-  Bad: "Generated with Claude Code"
    10-  Good: "Fix TypeScript compilation errors and improve type safety"
    11
    12**Always follow conventional commit format:**
    13- Focus commit messages on technical changes and their purpose
    14- Use clear, descriptive commit messages
    15- No Claude attribution in any git messages
    16
    17##  Documentation Structure
    18
    19**ALWAYS refer to the organized documentation structure:**

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

##  CRITICAL GIT GUIDELINES - READ FIRST 

**NEVER mention Claude in commit messages or PR descriptions**
-  Bad: "Claude fixed the TypeScript errors"
-  Bad: "Generated with Claude Code"
-  Good: "Fix TypeScript compilation errors and improve type safety"

**Always follow conventional commit format:**
- Focus commit messages on technical changes and their purpose
- Use clear, descriptive commit messages
- No Claude attribution in any git messages

##  Documentation Structure

**ALWAYS refer to the organized documentation structure:**

### Platform Documentation (External Sharing)
- **[FDIC Compliance Best Practices](./docs/platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)** -  **REQUIRED** - Financial services security standards
- **[API Documentation](./docs/platform-docs/api/)** - Complete API references for MATCH Pro, OFAC, and ORC
- **[User Guides](./docs/platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user documentation and training materials

### Internal Documentation (Development Team)
- **[Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md)** -  **CORE PHILOSOPHY** - Simplicity and maintainability guidelines
- **[Implementation Plans](./docs/internal/)** - Technical roadmaps and architecture decisions
- **[Operational Runbooks](./docs/internal/runbooks/)** - Deployment and maintenance procedures

### Reports (Compliance and Testing)
- **[Test Reports](./docs/reports/)** - Security audits, performance testing, compliance verification
- **[Phase Reviews](./docs/reports/)** - Project milestone assessments and code reviews

### Archive (Historical Reference)
- **[Archived Documentation](./docs/archive/)** - Historical plans and superseded documentation

##  Recent Security Changes (2024-10-31)

**Phase 0 - Security Remediation: COMPLETED** 

Critical security vulnerabilities have been addressed per the [Clean Architecture Refactor Plan](./docs/clean-architecture-refactor-plan.md):

###  Security Incident Identified and Remediated

**Issue**: Production encryption keys and JWT secrets were committed to git history in `generated-keys/` directory.

**Impact**: CRITICAL - Would fail FDIC audit. Full details in [Security Incident Report](./docs/reports/SECURITY_INCIDENT_2024-10-31.md).

**Remediation Completed**:
-  Removed `generated-keys/` directory from working tree
-  Added comprehensive security exclusions to `.gitignore`
-  Created security incident report with remediation plan
-  Created [Secret Management Runbook](./docs/internal/runbooks/secret-management.md)
-  Created secure `.env.example` template

** IMMEDIATE ACTIONS REQUIRED (Team Coordination)**:
1. **Rotate Production Keys** - Within 24 hours (see incident report)
2. **Clean Git History** - Requires force push coordination (see incident report)
3. **Re-encrypt PII Data** - Within 1 week (see incident report)

**New Documentation**:
- [Security Incident Report (2024-10-31)](./docs/reports/SECURITY_INCIDENT_2024-10-31.md) - Full incident analysis and remediation plan
- [Secret Management Runbook](./docs/internal/runbooks/secret-management.md) - Comprehensive secret management procedures
- [.env.example](./.env.example) - Secure environment variable template

**Next Phase**: Phase 1 - Foundation & Shared Package (see refactor plan)

##  Core Development Principles

**MANDATORY: Read [Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md) before any changes**

### Keep It Simple
- One solution, not three with fallbacks
- Standard library over custom implementations
- Delete unused code immediately
- Explicit over clever

### Boring Technology Wins
- Postgres > Redis (unless proven need)
- Simple cron > Queue system (for low volume)
- Direct function calls > Middleware layers
- Standard approaches > Custom implementations

### Build for Today
- Solve current problems, not imaginary future ones
- 10 merchants/day  10,000/day requirements
- Optimize when metrics show bottlenecks
- Add features when users ask

### Maintainability First
- Can a new developer understand it in 1 week?
- Can we debug it at 2 AM?
- Can we explain it to FDIC auditors?
- What happens if the person who wrote this leaves?

## Project Overview

This is a **simplified** financial compliance platform built for banks with limited resources. After architecture simplification, it focuses on core functionality with minimal operational overhead.

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

##  CRITICAL GIT GUIDELINES - READ FIRST 

**NEVER mention Claude in commit messages or PR descriptions**
-  Bad: "Claude fixed the TypeScript errors"
-  Bad: "Generated with Claude Code"
-  Good: "Fix TypeScript compilation errors and improve type safety"

**Always follow conventional commit format:**
- Focus commit messages on technical changes and their purpose
- Use clear, descriptive commit messages
- No Claude attribution in any git messages

##  Documentation Structure

**ALWAYS refer to the organized documentation structure:**

### Platform Documentation (External Sharing)
- **[FDIC Compliance Best Practices](./docs/platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)** -  **REQUIRED** - Financial services security standards
- **[API Documentation](./docs/platform-docs/api/)** - Complete API references for MATCH Pro, OFAC, and ORC
- **[User Guides](./docs/platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user documentation and training materials

### Internal Documentation (Development Team)
- **[Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md)** -  **CORE PHILOSOPHY** - Simplicity and maintainability guidelines
- **[Implementation Plans](./docs/internal/)** - Technical roadmaps and architecture decisions
- **[Operational Runbooks](./docs/internal/runbooks/)** - Deployment and maintenance procedures

### Reports (Compliance and Testing)
- **[Test Reports](./docs/reports/)** - Security audits, performance testing, compliance verification
- **[Phase Reviews](./docs/reports/)** - Project milestone assessments and code reviews

### Archive (Historical Reference)
- **[Archived Documentation](./docs/archive/)** - Historical plans and superseded documentation

##  Recent Security Changes (2024-10-31)

**Phase 0 - Security Remediation: COMPLETED** 

Critical security vulnerabilities have been addressed per the [Clean Architecture Refactor Plan](./docs/clean-architecture-refactor-plan.md):

###  Security Incident Identified and Remediated

**Issue**: Production encryption keys and JWT secrets were committed to git history in `generated-keys/` directory.

**Impact**: CRITICAL - Would fail FDIC audit. Full details in [Security Incident Report](./docs/reports/SECURITY_INCIDENT_2024-10-31.md).

**Remediation Completed**:
-  Removed `generated-keys/` directory from working tree
-  Added comprehensive security exclusions to `.gitignore`
-  Created security incident report with remediation plan
-  Created [Secret Management Runbook](./docs/internal/runbooks/secret-management.md)
-  Created secure `.env.example` template

** IMMEDIATE ACTIONS REQUIRED (Team Coordination)**:
1. **Rotate Production Keys** - Within 24 hours (see incident report)
2. **Clean Git History** - Requires force push coordination (see incident report)
3. **Re-encrypt PII Data** - Within 1 week (see incident report)

**New Documentation**:
- [Security Incident Report (2024-10-31)](./docs/reports/SECURITY_INCIDENT_2024-10-31.md) - Full incident analysis and remediation plan
- [Secret Management Runbook](./docs/internal/runbooks/secret-management.md) - Comprehensive secret management procedures
- [.env.example](./.env.example) - Secure environment variable template

**Next Phase**: Phase 1 - Foundation & Shared Package (see refactor plan)

##  Core Development Principles

**MANDATORY: Read [Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md) before any changes**

### Keep It Simple
- One solution, not three with fallbacks
- Standard library over custom implementations
- Delete unused code immediately
- Explicit over clever

### Boring Technology Wins
- Postgres > Redis (unless proven need)
- Simple cron > Queue system (for low volume)
- Direct function calls > Middleware layers
- Standard approaches > Custom implementations

### Build for Today
- Solve current problems, not imaginary future ones
- 10 merchants/day  10,000/day requirements
- Optimize when metrics show bottlenecks
- Add features when users ask

### Maintainability First
- Can a new developer understand it in 1 week?
- Can we debug it at 2 AM?
- Can we explain it to FDIC auditors?
- What happens if the person who wrote this leaves?

## Project Overview

This is a **simplified** financial compliance platform built for banks with limited resources. After architecture simplification, it focuses on core functionality with minimal operational overhead.

### Simplified Architecture (Post-Phase 4)

- **Frontend**: Next.js 15 with App Router, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS v4
- **Backend**: Fastify API server with TypeScript (simplified middleware stack)
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM (direct queries, no custom middleware)
- **Authentication**: JWT with consolidated auth middleware
- **APIs**: Mastercard MATCH Pro, OFAC Treasury, ORC risk assessment

### Key Simplifications Implemented
- **Middleware Layers**: 7  3 (auth + rate limiting + validation)
- **Environment Variables**: 150+  40 (essential only)
- **Dependencies**: 60+  30 (removed unnecessary libraries)
- **Code Files**: 295  150 TypeScript files
- **Test Files**: 511  150 (focused on critical paths)

## Simplified Project Structure

```
match/
  api-server/                    # Simplified Fastify backend
     src/
        routes/               # API endpoints
        services/             # Core business logic only
           mastercard/      # MATCH Pro integration
           ofac/            # Simplified OFAC (exact matching only)
           auth/            # Authentication services
        db/                  # Database schema & migrations
        middleware/          # Combined auth middleware (3 layers total)
        types/               # TypeScript definitions

  src/                          # Next.js frontend
     app/                     # App Router structure
     components/              # Flattened component structure
        ui/                  # shadcn/ui components
        forms/               # Form components (flat structure)
        match/               # MATCH Pro features
        ofac/                # OFAC features
        orc/                 # ORC features
        layouts/             # Layout components
     lib/                     # Utility libraries
     hooks/                   # Reduced to ~25 essential hooks

  docs/                         # Organized documentation structure
     platform-docs/          # External sharing approved
     internal/                # Development team only
     reports/                 # Testing and compliance
     archive/                 # Historical reference

  public/                       # Static assets
```

## Essential Commands

- **Development**: `npm run dev` (Turbopack enabled)
- **API Server**: `cd api-server && npm run dev`
- **Build**: `npm run build`
- **Test**: `npm test` (focused test suite)
- **Lint**: `npm run lint`

## Technology Stack (Simplified)

### Frontend
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router
- **UI**: React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS v4
- **Components**: shadcn/ui
- **Forms**: React Hook Form + Zod
- **State**: Minimal state management (removed complex stores)

### Backend
- **API**: Fastify with simplified middleware
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL + Drizzle ORM
- **Auth**: JWT with consolidated authentication
- **Validation**: Zod schemas (shared between frontend/backend)

### Removed Complexity
- **No Redis**: Simple in-memory caching where needed
- **No Queue System**: Direct processing for low-volume operations
- **No Custom Encryption Middleware**: Simple field-level encryption
- **No Token Bucket Rate Limiting**: Simple request counting
- **No Complex Security Scripts**: Manual procedures with runbooks

## Development Guidelines

### Before Making Changes
1. **Read [Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md)**
2. **Check existing patterns** in the simplified codebase
3. **Verify changes align with simplicity goals**
4. **Ensure maintainability for bank teams**

### Code Quality Standards
- **Maximum**: 50 lines per function, 300 lines per file
- **Error Handling**: Fail fast with clear messages
- **Testing**: Focus on critical business logic and user workflows
- **Documentation**: Explain WHY, not WHAT

### Security (Simplified)
- **Authentication**: JWT with proper expiration
- **Authorization**: Role-based access control (simplified RBAC)
- **Input Validation**: Comprehensive Zod schemas
- **Rate Limiting**: Simple global rate limiting (100 req/min)
- **Data Protection**: Field-level encryption for PII

## Key Features (Simplified)

### MATCH Pro Integration
- Termination inquiries with exact matching
- Merchant additions with principal management
- Simple inquiry history and reporting

### OFAC Compliance
- Direct Treasury API integration
- Exact name matching (removed fuzzy matching complexity)
- Simple weekly data synchronization
- Basic screening workflow

### ORC Risk Assessment
- Simplified polling mechanism (10 attempts max)
- Direct API integration
- Basic status tracking

### User Management
- Simplified role-based access (4 roles)
- ICA-based data isolation
- Basic user registration workflow

## Deployment (MVP Ready)

### Environment Requirements (40 variables total)
```bash
# Essential only - see docs/internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md
DATABASE_URL=
JWT_SECRET=
ENCRYPTION_KEY=
MASTERCARD_CONSUMER_KEY=
MASTERCARD_P12_BASE64=
# ... and 35 other essential variables
```

### Production Stack
- **Frontend**: Vercel (automatic deployment)
- **Backend**: Railway (container deployment)
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL (managed)
- **Monitoring**: Built-in platform monitoring

## Support and Maintenance

### Operational Procedures
- See **[Operational Runbooks](./docs/internal/runbooks/)** for detailed procedures
- **Daily**: Health checks and basic monitoring
- **Weekly**: Performance review and security checks
- **Monthly**: Dependency updates and maintenance

### Emergency Contacts
- Refer to **[Operational Procedures](./docs/internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)** for current contact information

## Success Metrics (Achieved)

- **Codebase Reduction**: 50% fewer files
- **Configuration Simplification**: 75% fewer environment variables
- **Deployment Time**: Reduced from 4-6 hours to 1-2 hours
- **Onboarding Time**: New developers productive in 2-3 weeks (vs 2-3 months)
- **Maintenance Burden**: Significantly reduced operational complexity

---

**Philosophy**: Build a Toyota Camry that works reliably, not a Formula 1 car that requires a pit crew.

**Remember**: This platform is designed for banks with limited resources. Every technical decision should prioritize simplicity, maintainability, and operational efficiency over theoretical perfection.
- I am not opposed to redis but in an earlier refactor it was removed. Lets make sure we are using the tools that will make this a secure app that can pass an fdic audit but also easy to manage. If a new tool is needed verify with me and lets discuss pros and cons

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

##  CRITICAL GIT GUIDELINES - READ FIRST 

**NEVER mention Claude in commit messages or PR descriptions**
-  Bad: "Claude fixed the TypeScript errors"
-  Bad: "Generated with Claude Code"
-  Good: "Fix TypeScript compilation errors and improve type safety"

**Always follow conventional commit format:**
- Focus commit messages on technical changes and their purpose
- Use clear, descriptive commit messages
- No Claude attribution in any git messages

##  Documentation Structure

**ALWAYS refer to the organized documentation structure - See [Complete Documentation Index](./docs/README.md)**

### Platform Documentation (External Sharing)
- **[FDIC Compliance Best Practices](./docs/platform-docs/compliance/fdic-software-development-best-practices.md)** -  **REQUIRED** - Financial services security standards
- **[API Documentation](./docs/platform-docs/api/)** - Complete API references for MATCH Pro, OFAC, and ORC
- **[User Guides](./docs/platform-docs/user-guides/)** - End-user documentation and training materials

### Internal Documentation (Development Team)
- **[Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md)** -  **CORE PHILOSOPHY** - Simplicity and maintainability guidelines
- **[Implementation Plans](./docs/internal/)** - Technical roadmaps and architecture decisions
- **[Operational Runbooks](./docs/internal/runbooks/)** - Deployment and maintenance procedures

### Architecture Documentation
- **[Clean Architecture Refactor Plan](./docs/architecture/clean-architecture-refactor-plan.md)** - Multi-phase refactoring roadmap
- **[Error Boundaries](./docs/architecture/error-boundaries.md)** - Error handling architecture

### Security & Compliance
- **[Security Documentation](./docs/security/)** - Security posture, procedures, and audit reports
- **[Compliance Documentation](./docs/compliance/)** - FDIC compliance and PII encryption reports

### Reports & Runbooks
- **[Test Reports](./docs/test-reports/)** - Security audits, performance testing, compliance verification
- **[Phase Reviews](./docs/reports/)** - Project milestone assessments and code reviews
- **[Operational Runbooks](./docs/runbooks/)** - Security and operational procedures

### Scripts Organization
- **[Database Scripts](./scripts/db/)** - Database migrations and maintenance
- **[Security Scripts](./scripts/security/)** - Encryption, key rotation, and security tools
- **[Maintenance Scripts](./scripts/maintenance/)** - System maintenance utilities

### Archive (Historical Reference)
- **[Archived Documentation](./docs/archive/)** - Historical plans and superseded documentation
- **[Phase 4 Archive](./docs/archive/2024-10-refactor/)** - Documentation consolidation archive

##  Recent Security Changes (2024-10-31)

**Phase 0 - Security Remediation: COMPLETED** 

Critical security vulnerabilities have been addressed per the [Clean Architecture Refactor Plan](./docs/clean-architecture-refactor-plan.md):

###  Security Incident Identified and Remediated

**Issue**: Production encryption keys and JWT secrets were committed to git history in `generated-keys/` directory.

**Impact**: CRITICAL - Would fail FDIC audit. Full details in [Security Incident Report](./docs/reports/SECURITY_INCIDENT_2024-10-31.md).

**Remediation Completed**:
-  Removed `generated-keys/` directory from working tree
-  Added comprehensive security exclusions to `.gitignore`
-  Created security incident report with remediation plan
-  Created [Secret Management Runbook](./docs/internal/runbooks/secret-management.md)
-  Created secure `.env.example` template

** IMMEDIATE ACTIONS REQUIRED (Team Coordination)**:
1. **Rotate Production Keys** - Within 24 hours (see incident report)
2. **Clean Git History** - Requires force push coordination (see incident report)
3. **Re-encrypt PII Data** - Within 1 week (see incident report)

**New Documentation**:
- [Security Incident Report (2024-10-31)](./docs/reports/SECURITY_INCIDENT_2024-10-31.md) - Full incident analysis and remediation plan
- [Secret Management Runbook](./docs/internal/runbooks/secret-management.md) - Comprehensive secret management procedures
- [.env.example](./.env.example) - Secure environment variable template

**Next Phase**: Phase 1 - Foundation & Shared Package (see refactor plan)

##  Core Development Principles

**MANDATORY: Read [Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md) before any changes**

### Keep It Simple
- One solution, not three with fallbacks
- Standard library over custom implementations
- Delete unused code immediately
- Explicit over clever

### Boring Technology Wins
- Postgres > Redis (unless proven need)
- Simple cron > Queue system (for low volume)
- Direct function calls > Middleware layers
- Standard approaches > Custom implementations

### Build for Today
- Solve current problems, not imaginary future ones
- 10 merchants/day  10,000/day requirements
- Optimize when metrics show bottlenecks
- Add features when users ask

### Maintainability First
- Can a new developer understand it in 1 week?
- Can we debug it at 2 AM?
- Can we explain it to FDIC auditors?
- What happens if the person who wrote this leaves?

## Project Overview

This is a **simplified** financial compliance platform built for banks with limited resources. After architecture simplification, it focuses on core functionality with minimal operational overhead.

### Simplified Architecture (Post-Phase 4)

- **Frontend**: Next.js 15 with App Router, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS v4
- **Backend**: Fastify API server with TypeScript (simplified middleware stack)
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL with Drizzle ORM (direct queries, no custom middleware)
- **Authentication**: JWT with consolidated auth middleware
- **APIs**: Mastercard MATCH Pro, OFAC Treasury, ORC risk assessment

### Key Simplifications Implemented
- **Middleware Layers**: 7  3 (auth + rate limiting + validation)
- **Environment Variables**: 150+  40 (essential only)
- **Dependencies**: 60+  30 (removed unnecessary libraries)
- **Code Files**: 295  150 TypeScript files
- **Test Files**: 511  150 (focused on critical paths)

## Simplified Project Structure

```
match/
  api-server/                    # Simplified Fastify backend
     src/
        routes/               # API endpoints
        services/             # Core business logic only
           mastercard/      # MATCH Pro integration
           ofac/            # Simplified OFAC (exact matching only)
           auth/            # Authentication services
        db/                  # Database schema & migrations
        middleware/          # Combined auth middleware (3 layers total)
        types/               # TypeScript definitions

  src/                          # Next.js frontend
     app/                     # App Router structure
     components/              # Flattened component structure
        ui/                  # shadcn/ui components
        forms/               # Form components (flat structure)
        match/               # MATCH Pro features
        ofac/                # OFAC features
        orc/                 # ORC features
        layouts/             # Layout components
     lib/                     # Utility libraries
     hooks/                   # Reduced to ~25 essential hooks

  docs/                         # Organized documentation structure
     platform-docs/          # External sharing approved
     internal/                # Development team only
     reports/                 # Testing and compliance
     archive/                 # Historical reference

  public/                       # Static assets
```

## Essential Commands

- **Development**: `npm run dev` (Turbopack enabled)
- **API Server**: `cd api-server && npm run dev`
- **Build**: `npm run build`
- **Test**: `npm test` (focused test suite)
- **Lint**: `npm run lint`

## Technology Stack (Simplified)

### Frontend
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router
- **UI**: React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS v4
- **Components**: shadcn/ui
- **Forms**: React Hook Form + Zod
- **State**: Minimal state management (removed complex stores)

### Backend
- **API**: Fastify with simplified middleware
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL + Drizzle ORM
- **Auth**: JWT with consolidated authentication
- **Validation**: Zod schemas (shared between frontend/backend)

### Removed Complexity
- **No Redis**: Simple in-memory caching where needed
- **No Queue System**: Direct processing for low-volume operations
- **No Custom Encryption Middleware**: Simple field-level encryption
- **No Token Bucket Rate Limiting**: Simple request counting
- **No Complex Security Scripts**: Manual procedures with runbooks

## Development Guidelines

### Before Making Changes
1. **Read [Development Principles](./docs/internal/development-principles.md)**
2. **Check existing patterns** in the simplified codebase
3. **Verify changes align with simplicity goals**
4. **Ensure maintainability for bank teams**

### Code Quality Standards
- **Maximum**: 50 lines per function, 300 lines per file
- **Error Handling**: Fail fast with clear messages
- **Testing**: Focus on critical business logic and user workflows
- **Documentation**: Explain WHY, not WHAT

### Security (Simplified)
- **Authentication**: JWT with proper expiration
- **Authorization**: Role-based access control (simplified RBAC)
- **Input Validation**: Comprehensive Zod schemas
- **Rate Limiting**: Simple global rate limiting (100 req/min)
- **Data Protection**: Field-level encryption for PII

## Key Features (Simplified)

### MATCH Pro Integration
- Termination inquiries with exact matching
- Merchant additions with principal management
- Simple inquiry history and reporting

### OFAC Compliance
- Direct Treasury API integration
- Exact name matching (removed fuzzy matching complexity)
- Simple weekly data synchronization
- Basic screening workflow

### ORC Risk Assessment
- Simplified polling mechanism (10 attempts max)
- Direct API integration
- Basic status tracking

### User Management
- Simplified role-based access (4 roles)
- ICA-based data isolation
- Basic user registration workflow

## Deployment (MVP Ready)

### Environment Requirements (40 variables total)
```bash
# Essential only - see docs/internal/runbooks/mvp-deployment-checklist.md
DATABASE_URL=
JWT_SECRET=
ENCRYPTION_KEY=
MASTERCARD_CONSUMER_KEY=
MASTERCARD_P12_BASE64=
# ... and 35 other essential variables
```

### Production Stack
- **Frontend**: Vercel (automatic deployment)
- **Backend**: Railway (container deployment)
- **Database**: Neon PostgreSQL (managed)
- **Monitoring**: Built-in platform monitoring

## Support and Maintenance

### Operational Procedures
- See **[Operational Runbooks](./docs/internal/runbooks/)** for detailed procedures
- **Daily**: Health checks and basic monitoring
- **Weekly**: Performance review and security checks
- **Monthly**: Dependency updates and maintenance

### Emergency Contacts
- Refer to **[Operational Procedures](./docs/internal/runbooks/operational-procedures.md)** for current contact information

## Success Metrics (Achieved)

- **Codebase Reduction**: 50% fewer files
- **Configuration Simplification**: 75% fewer environment variables
- **Deployment Time**: Reduced from 4-6 hours to 1-2 hours
- **Onboarding Time**: New developers productive in 2-3 weeks (vs 2-3 months)
- **Maintenance Burden**: Significantly reduced operational complexity

---

**Philosophy**: Build a Toyota Camry that works reliably, not a Formula 1 car that requires a pit crew.

**Remember**: This platform is designed for banks with limited resources. Every technical decision should prioritize simplicity, maintainability, and operational efficiency over theoretical perfection.
- I am not opposed to redis but in an earlier refactor it was removed. Lets make sure we are using the tools that will make this a secure app that can pass an fdic audit but also easy to manage. If a new tool is needed verify with me and lets discuss pros and cons
